attributes.comment:
To Whom It May Concern:
I am very dismayed to learn of the sharp increase in fees relating to the
naturalization process. Such fees will have precisely the opposite effect of what
many want, which is to see residents become citizens. Those of you who
designed the changes would appear to have absolutely no understanding of what
$700 fees look like to people struggling to survive on oftentimes minimum wage
jobs. At the very least you could consider a needs-based fee. If current fees do not
provide adequate resources, I suggest we begin looking not at potential citizens
but at the excessive tax cuts that have helped create the enormous budget deficit
we are facing.
Sincerely,
Ellen Bigler

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Ellen Bigler
